I'm sitting at the East Gate of Jerusalem,
 waiting for a sign of God.
 The ground is hard packed quiet,
 and the trumpets lay at rest.
 
 I'm sitting at the East Gate of Jerusalem,
 waiting for a sign of God.
 They say when he comes back, this is where it will be,
 this is where I should wait.
 
 I see nothing but the haze of the sand,
 burning images of time into my eyes.
 A drop in the barrell for every forged soul,
 a drop for every forgotten cry.
 
 I'm sitting in the doorway of a children's shelter,
 waiting for a sign of God.
 A child runs by, dripping with juice,
 stained with tears.
 
 I want to see him,
 I want to say that
 children's blood should be blue,
 never red.
 
 I'm sitting at the East Gate of Jerusalem,
 writing my name in the sand.
 In case I get left behind, 
 I want to remember who I am.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  "The East Gate of Jerusalem." Poem.
